intro: Nonea pallens, commonly known as the pale nonea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are pale green to white in color. Nonea pallens is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
